author: Joe Deaux, Catherine Lucey
description: US President Donald Trump’s promised 50% copper tariffs are set to include all refined metal, indicating the president’s far-reaching efforts to bolster American production of one of the world’s most ubiquitous materials.
title: Trump’s 50% Copper Import Tariff Said to Cover Refined Metal

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: White House trade adviser Peter Navarro encouraged Canada to continue negotiating with the US to lower trade barriers after President Donald Trump announced a 35% tariff on the North American neighbor.
title: Navarro Urges Canada to ‘Negotiate Fairly’ Before August Tariff Deadline

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: A senior UN World Food Programme official said the situation in the Gaza Strip is “worse than I’ve ever seen it before” with about 90,000 women and children suffering from malnutrition, and again called for a ceasefire.
title: Gaza Ceasefire ‘Urgent’ as Situation Worsens, UN Official Says

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House correspondent Hadriana Lowenkron looks at the debate within the administration over federal disaster relief. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Views Texas Disaster Scene as FEMA’s Future Is Up in Air

author: Ekow Dontoh
description: Ghana’s ruling party has cemented its rise to power after comfortably securing two-thirds of the seats in parliament.
title: Ghana’s Ruling Party Cements Power With Super-Majority Win

author: Alberto Nardelli, Jorge Valero
description: Cars and tariff levels on agriculture have emerged as key sticking points between the European Union and the US as the two sides work toward a provisional trade agreement in the coming days, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: A US-EU Trade Deal Hinges on Cars, Agriculture and Trump

author: Kateryna Chursina
description: Ukraine’s State Bureau of Investigation accused the head of the Anti-Corruption Action Center, Vitaliy Shabunin, of evading military service, raising concerns of possible political revenge.
title: Ukraine Anti-Graft Activist Accused of Dodging Army Service

author: Kate Sullivan
description: President Donald Trump in Texas on Friday viewed firsthand the devastation left by extreme flooding that killed at least 120 people and left scores still missing in the state’s Hill Country region, seeking to reassure residents of the federal response to the disaster.
title: Trump Sees Devastation From Texas Floods in Visit to State

author: Jarrell Dillard, Daniel Flatley
description: US revenue from customs duties this fiscal year surpassed $100 billion for the first time, reflecting higher tariffs imposed by the Trump administration.
title: US Tariffs Revenue Climbs to Fresh Record for Single Fiscal Year

author: Daryna Krasnolutska
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said the US resumed shipping military aid to Ukraine, which was unexpectedly put on halt last week.
title: Zelenskiy Says US Has Resumed Military Aid Supply to Ukraine

author: Alberto Nardelli, Ewa Krukowska
description: The European Union took a tentative step closer to a new price-cap regime on Russian oil that would aim to push the price of Moscow’s barrels down even further and keep the pressure on in the future.
title: EU Edges Closer to New Price-Cap Regime for Russian Oil Trade

author: Alaric Nightingale
description: Ukraine said it has blasted a gas pipeline in western Siberia that feeds military production facilities in three Russian regions.
title: Ukraine Says It Blew Up Russia Domestic Gas Link in West Siberia

author: Jim Wyss, Ruth Liao
description: The official in charge of addressing Puerto Rico’s power crisis is pushing to move forward with New Fortress Energy Inc.’s proposed $20 billion contract to supply the island with natural gas, saying a federal watchdog’s concerns about the deal are overwrought.
title: Puerto Rico Energy Czar Backs New Fortress LNG Supply Deal

author: Michael Mackenzie, Alice Gledhill
description: US President Donald Trump is likely to stick with convention when he picks the next Federal Reserve Chair, according to one of the world’s biggest bond managers.
title: Pimco Bond Chief Says Trump Will Make Orthodox Choice for Fed Chief

author: Matt Day
description: A group of Microsoft Corp. investors is pressuring the company to assess how effectively it identifies customers who misuse its artificial intelligence tools, a push that follows reports detailing the Israeli military’s use of Microsoft software during its war in Gaza.
title: Microsoft Investors Prod Company Over Work With Israeli Military

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen, Eltaf Najafizada
description: India’s foreign minister will visit China this weekend in his first trip in over five years, people familiar with the matter said, as the two Asian neighbors work to repair ties following deadly border clashes in 2020.
title: India’s Foreign Minister to Make First China Visit in Five Years

author: Stephanie Hughes, Geoffrey Morgan
description: The latest salvo in US President Donald Trump’s trade dispute with Canada may hit a relatively small pool of goods, but North American stock markets aren’t fully appreciating the risk, according to CIBC Capital Markets.
title: Trump’s Tariffs on Canada Not Priced Into Markets, CIBC Says

author: Ailbhe Rea
description: The Labour party’s biggest affiliate trade union, Unite, has suspended Deputy Prime Minister Angela Rayner, as a dispute over a strike gripping the city of Birmingham deepens.
title: Labour’s Biggest Affiliate Trade Union Suspends Angela Rayner

author: Moses Mozart Dzawu
description: Mali’s government seized more than a ton of gold from Barrick Mining Corp., days after the West African nation’s junta leader signed a law granting himself a mandate renewable forever.
title: Mali Seizes Barrick Gold as Junta Leader Claims Indefinite Rule

author: Daryna Krasnolutska, Olesia Safronova
description: North Korea is now supplying as much as 40% of Russia’s ammunition for the war in Ukraine as the partnership between Pyongyang and Moscow deepens, according to the head of Ukrainian military intelligence.
title: Ukraine Spy Chief Says 40% of Russian Ammunition Is North Korean

author: Paul Wallace
description: As he often has during his rule, the Turkish president is showing an ability to thrive in turbulent times.
title: Erdogan Is Sitting Pretty Amid Turkish Tumult

author: Zeke Faux, Muyao Shen, Anthony Cormier
description: The exchange has been a coder, a promoter and an early adopter for World Liberty Financial’s stablecoin, people familiar with the matter say. Critics say the relationship poses a conflict of interest for President Trump.
title: Binance Aided Trump Crypto Firm Before Founder CZ Sought Pardon

author: Eric Martin, Colum Murphy
description: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio said a summit between President Donald Trump and Chinese leader Xi Jinping is likely after having his first face-to-face meeting with his Chinese counterpart in Malaysia.
title: Rubio Says Xi-Trump Summit Likely After Meeting Top China Envoy

author: Kamil Kowalcze
description: Chancellor Friedrich Merz’s €46 billion ($53 billion) package of tax breaks was approved by German upper-house lawmakers, the final legislative hurdle for the measures the ruling coalition hopes will deliver a quick fillip to Europe’s biggest economy.
title: Merz’s €46 Billion Tax-Break Package Gets Final Lawmaker Backing

author: Beril Akman, Firat Kozok
description: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s chief adviser, a supporter of the low-interest rates policies which helped drive Turkish inflation over 80% in recent years, has died.
title: Erdogan Aide Who Backed Turkey’s Unorthodox Rate Policies Dies

author: Ugur Yilmaz
description: The Kurdish militant group PKK will begin laying down its arms on Friday, marking the start of a disarmament process aimed at ending one of the Middle East’s longest-running insurgencies.
title: Kurdish Militants Begin Disarming After 40-Year War With Turkey

author: Francesca Stevens, Josh Wingrove, Nguyen Dieu Tu Uyen
description: Vietnam’s leadership was caught off guard by US President Donald Trump’s announcement last week that it agreed to a 20% tariff, and the Southeast Asian nation is still seeking to lower the rate, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Vietnam Surprised by Trump Tariff Announcement, Seeks Lower Rate

author: Sabrina Nelson Garcinuno
description: Tourism in Spain, Europe’s second largest holiday destination, will grow less than previously expected as economic and geopolitical uncertainties weigh on appetite for travel.
title: Spanish Tourism Growth to Slow as Uncertainties Hit Travel

author: Thomas Seal, Randy Thanthong-Knight, Melissa Shin
description: It seems that nothing Canada has tried so far has shielded it from the threats of Donald Trump.
title: Trump’s 35% Tariff Bulldozer Tests Carney’s Strategy of Avoiding Conflict

author: Khine Lin Kyaw
description: Myanmar’s junta chief Min Aung Hlaing praised Donald Trump in a rare letter and compared his military’s coup to the US president’s baseless claims of election fraud, suggesting both leaders were victims of rigged votes.
title: Myanmar Junta Chief Hails Trump, Likens Coup to 2020 US Election

author: Suttinee Yuvejwattana
description: Thaksin Shinawatra, the de facto leader of Thailand’s ruling party, is taking a more proactive role in shaping the country’s response to deal with the fallout of President Donald Trump’s threat to impose a steep 36% tariff on its exports to the US.
title: Thaksin Joins Thai Ministers in Fine-tuning Response to Trump Tariff Threat

author: Yoshiaki Nohara
description: Chinese Vice Premier He Lifeng and a senior official in Japan’s ruling party discussed speeding up the process to lift a ban on Japan’s beef exports to China, according to the public broadcaster NHK.
title: China, Japan Discuss Speeding Up Beef Export Ban Lift, NHK Says

author: Justice Malala
description: “Abusive” tariffs and visa bans, coupled with suspicions of cynical “peace for exploitation” and extractive deal-making, are causing anger and resentment.
title: The US’s Africa Policy Is Now Crystal Clear. Its Success Is Not.

author: Yoshiaki Nohara
description: Japan’s top tariff negotiator Ryosei Akazawa may come under renewed pressure in the coming days as he faces the risk of missing out on talks with the two key US officials entrusted with trade negotiations when they visit Osaka.
title: Japan’s Akazawa Faces Bad Optics Risk as Lutnick, Bessent Visit

author: John Liu, Fran Wang
description: China should add as much as 1.5 trillion yuan ($209 billion) in fresh stimulus to boost consumer spending and maintain currency flexibility to counter US tariffs’ drag on growth, academics including an adviser to the country’s central bank said.
title: PBOC Adviser Urges $209 Billion Stimulus to Counter US Tariffs

author: Heesu Lee
description: South Korea’s top trade official said negotiations with the US on tariffs have entered a critical phase, after wrapping up meetings in Washington and returning to Seoul late Thursday.
title: South Korea’s Trade Chief Seeks ‘Landing Zone’ in US Trade Talks

author: Eric Martin, Manolo Serapio Jr
description: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio said Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. is scheduled to visit Washington soon as he underlined the strong ties between the two nations along with Japan.
title: Philippines’ Marcos Set to Visit US in a ‘Few Days,’ Rubio Says

author: Swati Pandey
description: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said Friday he will not shy away from raising security and human rights concerns when he meets with President Xi Jinping during a visit to China.
title: Australia PM Says He’ll Raise Security, Rights Issues With China

author: Yoshiaki Nohara, Yuko Takeo
description: Tokyo complained to Beijing after Chinese fighter jets tailed Japanese patrol aircraft twice this week, according to the Foreign Affairs Ministry.
title: Japan Protests Chinese Fighter Jets Tailing Japanese Aircraft

author: Derek Wallbank
description: President Donald Trump said he plans to make a “major statement” on Russia, as the US prepares to send more American weapons to Ukraine via purchases from NATO allies.
title: Trump Plans ‘Major’ Russia Statement Monday, Mulls Sanctions

author: Festus Poquie
description: President Donald Trump’s administration discussed sending deported migrants to Africa with five of the continent’s leaders holding a summit with the US President in Washington.
title: Trump Seeks Deal With African Leaders on Deported Migrants

author: Catherine Lucey, Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump will levy a 35% tariff on goods coming into the US from Canada, he said in a post on Truth Social. The tariff level would take effect from Aug. 1.
title: Trump to Impose 35% Tariff on Goods From Canada
